message:
Vote for React Bangkok 2.1.0 speaker!!
1. (canceled) Scaling Redux Application with Ducks and Redux-Saga
Any framework works well in small scale but will face the common set of problems when scaling to be a big big application. With Ducks (https://github.com/erikras/ducks-modular-redux), we can separate physical modules well enough to support adding more and more features. Redux-Saga will help us separate flow control logic out of normal uni-direction data flow (which intend to manage application state, not the application flow) in a very clean and testable way. This talk comes from my experience combine those two together to help me scaling my Redux-based applications.
Speaker: Amp Tanawat (Frontend Architect@Proteus Technologies) (https://github.com/codewithcats)
-------------------
2. Atomic Design with Next.js
- Short brief, what‚Äôs Next.js
- Short brief, what‚Äôs Atomic Design
- How to apply this concept in Next.js (Might have live coding)
Speaker: Pallop Chaoputhipuchong
https://github.com/vannizer
https://blog.vannizer.com/
-------------------
3. Zero to Zeit
Quick talk on how we adopted now, next.js, and micro at ScreenCloud to enable rapid low friction development and deployment on zeit platform. 
Speaker: Luke Hubbard
http://github.com/luke
-------------------
4. Introduction to React Native and Firebase

message:
Hi, all! ReactNext 2017 is an annual React conference in Tel Aviv, Israel. Last year we had 600 attendees from 20 countries. This year it will be even bigger and better!

Check it out: http://react-next.com

We have 20 free and a bunch of discounted tickets for ReactNext 2017 to distribute among contributors to open source libraries related to React, React Native and the ecosystem. If you are an author, maintainer or a contributor and you want to get a free or a discounted ticket, please fill this short form and we will get in touch in early August.

We will collect submissions until July 31. 

http://bit.ly/2tJAoxv

‡∏Ç‡∏≠‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏∏‡∏ç‡∏≤‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏õ‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏Å‡∏≤‡∏®‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö‡∏™‡∏°‡∏±‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏á‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏ô‡∏∞‡∏Ñ‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö
Lawender is recruiting Front-End developer

We are building workflow-integrated marketplace for Legal Industry. We are currently seeking more front-end developer to boost our web applications to be part of our amazing team. We‚Äôre a disciplined and passionate team. Some of the part that press recognize us can be found more on our getlinks press session.

What will you be doing?
The front-end developer will work in a team environment in the design and execution of web products. We are looking for a self-starter who is excited to learn and improve his or her skillset in the ever-evolving medium of the web. The ideal candidate is a creative thinker with PASSION, DISCIPLINE and EXPERIENCES in front-end developer. 
‚Ä¢ If you know why law is important with all people lives ‚Äî then you know our clients.
‚Ä¢ If you know how to link the text/ legal text from the back-end to front-end  ‚Äî then you know what we want and how to deal with us to execute our product.
‚Ä¢ If you are the evangelist and the architect for the products you work on ‚Äî then you know our passion.
‚Ä¢ If coding world-class web products is something you eat, sleep, and dream ‚Äì then you are our best match.

Job Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Deliver best-in-class HTML5/Node.JS/Angular/JS front-end code across a broad array of interactive web and mobile projects.
‚Ä¢ Possess an advanced knowledge of web and mobile UX/UI; Semantic UI; adhere to and extrapolate complex design systems and apply to coded pages, screens, and states.
‚Ä¢ Develop and test across multiple browsers, platforms, and devices, including smartphones and tablets.
‚Ä¢ Understand when mobile web apps are appropriate as opposed to native applications.
‚Ä¢ Have experience with:
o JS/Node.JS/Angualr
‚Ä¢ Understand Agile methodology and instill best practices into the process.
Bachelor's degree or higher in a related discipline (preferred but not required). Minimum 2+ years in a front-end development position.
‚Ä¢ Experience in ElasticSearch is a plus.

Please contact Perada Suponpun, perada@lawender.co, with examples of your work, resume, and a brief write-up of why you are interested in this position and a good fit for Lawender. Please include brief descriptions of your role on specific projects

‡∏≠‡πà‡∏≤‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏≤‡∏¢‡∏•‡∏∞‡πÄ‡∏≠‡∏µ‡∏¢‡∏î‡πÄ‡∏û‡∏¥‡πà‡∏°‡πÄ‡∏ï‡∏¥‡∏°‡πÑ‡∏î‡πâ‡∏ó‡∏µ‡πà www.Thaiopenstack.org

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join this two-full-day conference & workshop to understand the core concepts of increasing cloud knowledge about Openstack and Docker Container that enterprises and individuals have encountered both public and private cloud. This event is an unique opportunity not only to learn, but to make important contacts and participate in the interactive workshop. The conference and workshop will feature presentations by thought leaders from industry, academia and government, including keynote speeches by Damrongsak Reetanon, Assistant Vice President at MFEC; Jirayut Nimsaeng, DevOps & Cloud Architect at Kaidee; Asst. Prof. Dr. Chanwit Kaewkasi, Suranaree University of Technology, and Dr. Sak Segkhoonthod, President and CEO at EGA. This event will be held on 22-23 September 2016 at Grand Postal Building, Bangrak, Thailand

More information: www.Thaiopenstack.org

message:
Hi guys,

I hope it is fine to post here a quick hello from **React Amsterdam team** and invite you to check on **React Amsterdam 2016 conference** that happened here in Amsterdam. I am pretty sure most of the videos might be useful for your React.js work & pleasure purposes. And not only!

Conference squeezed more than 200 people coming from Netherlands, Germany, France, Spain, UK, Russia, Ukraine, Israel, Afghanistan, and more. Amazing, right? 

We managed to get 12 great speakers who shared their unique experiences and practises from both global and local companies and freelance working with React.js in their projects. You find them in our playlist on YouTube https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLNBNS7NRGKMG3uLrm5fgY02hJ87Wzb4IU Feel free to like and share!

We worked pretty hard to get the conference in place for the first time this year and invested into making it really inspired and great space for interaction and learning. Check photos below and this (https://www.facebook.com/react.amsterdam/videos/253496405000461/) video to see if we reached our goal :)

React Amsterdam 2016 by Thomas Huisman https://www.facebook.com/react.amsterdam/photos/?tab=album&album_id=266084063741695
React Amsterdam 2016 by Artem Sapegin 
https://www.facebook.com/artemsapegin/media_set?set=a.10154184088118514.1073741838.665893513&type=3

Few folks even got us great and interesting review blogposts, so we could see ourselves from the other side
Here are the links:
https://medium.com/@kitze/lessons-learned-at-react-amsterdam-51f2006c4a59#.8qw494wo9 
https://medium.com/@sapegin/react-amsterdam-2016-20e1052b09f1#.2uxszzshi 
https://sc5.io/posts/react-amsterdam/
https://www.elements.nl/2016/04/19/react-amsterdam/

Many thanks to our great sponsors, of course, who was first to give us a hand and make it happen http://react-amsterdam.com/#sponsors

And YOU supporting us here on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/react.amsterdam/, Twitter https://twitter.com/ReactAmsterdam and mentally on a long distance! 

Last but not least ‚Äî if you liked what you see, join our user group here http://www.meetup.com/React-Amsterdam/, track http://react-amsterdam.com/ and join next year for 2017 edition!

message:
Hi guys,

I hope it is fine to post here a quick hello from **React Amsterdam team** and invite you to check our conference page. We worked pretty hard starting a conference for the first time this year, but really inspired to make it a great space for interaction and learning in Amsterdam, and hope you will support us in it!

We managed to get 12 great speakers who will share experience in working with React.js in their projects from Facebook to cool startups and freelance. We also expect lightning talks and community coming from all over Europe and a bit far away.

Conference starts in one month, and we squeezed to have 20 more tickets, that we distribute among subscribed to http://bit.ly/reactams-waitlist AND **1 of 5 tickets each week will go for free!**

We also plan on posting videos, slides, photos afterwards and would be happy if you share information about possible speakers you want to listen in 2017, or may be you want to become one of them.

Don't hesitate to hit like button and drop us a line! Thanks a lot! 

And if you are on Twitter, here we are too https://twitter.com/ReactAmsterdam

message:
Hey all,
I'm the CEO of Mozio (www.mozio.com), and we are looking for javascript & python developers to join our team.
Mozio is building the ultimate local transportation search and booking app: the vision is that you should have one app to be able to book every taxi/limo, shuttle, express train and even public transit on one interface, the ultimate mobility app. Our unique quality is that we are focused on the transaction, actually being able to take the booking across all these various forms of transportation, not just presenting information.
We just raised ~$2 million in VC funding and are looking to double the team, so I'd love to talk to anyone who is interested: david@mozio.com
Job postings:
JS/Angular/React: http://bit.ly/1QpkI9q
Python: http://bit.ly/1XCgwCS
David Litwak
